com.sadakatsu.clue.contestserver

Class Match

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sadakatsu.clue.contestserver.Match

  • public class Match
extends java.lang.Object
    The Match class runs a single Speed Clue game among the passed Players and saves data about the game played in such a way that it can be treated conceptually like a database record.
    Author:
    Joseph A. Craig

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Match(java.util.List<Player> players)
      Runs a Speed Clue game and stores the results.
      Match(java.util.List<Player> players, java.io.OutputStream log)
      Runs a Speed Clue game, writing log information to the passed OutputStream.

             TimeoutViolation,

             DisqualifiedPlayer,
             DuplicateSuggestion,
             InvalidDisprove,
             InvalidPlayerCount,

        Runs a Speed Clue game and stores the results. This constructor does not log the game play.
        Parameters:
        players - The Players participating in the Match, listed in play order.

      • Match

        public Match(java.util.List<Player> players,
     java.io.OutputStream log)
      throws ProtocolViolation,
             TimeoutViolation,
             java.io.IOException,
             DisqualifiedPlayer,
             DuplicateSuggestion,
             InvalidDisprove,
             InvalidPlayerCount,
             SuicidalAccusation,
             MissedAccusation
        Runs a Speed Clue game, writing log information to the passed OutputStream. The game's results are stored for later querying.
        Parameters:
        players - The Players participating in the Match, listed in play order.
        log - The OutputStream to which to write the Match log. If null, the game play will not be logged (as if Match(players) had been called).
        Throws:
        ProtocolViolation
        TimeoutViolation
        java.io.IOException
        DisqualifiedPlayer
        DuplicateSuggestion
        InvalidDisprove
        InvalidPlayerCount
        SuicidalAccusation
        MissedAccusation

    • Method Detail

      • hasDisqualifiedPlayer

        public boolean hasDisqualifiedPlayer()
        Determines whether any of the Players who competed in this Match were later disqualified, invalidating this Match's results.
        Returns:
        true if any of the Players were disqualified, false otherwise.

      • getPlayerCount

        public int getPlayerCount()
        Returns:
        The number of Players who participated in the match.

      • getRounds

        public int getRounds()
        Returns:
        The number of rounds this game lasted.

      • getHands

        public java.util.List<Hand> getHands()
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of the Hands dealt to each of the Players in ascending play order.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of the Players who participated in the game.

      • getWinner

        public Player getWinner()
        Returns:
        The Player that won the game.
